11:32 • 17 days ago

Monetha

10 Ways to Increase Repeat Purchases from your eCommerce Store

ECommerce business owners know that retaining loyal customers is more challenging than acquiring new ones. Repeat customers are responsible for ushering in a significant amount of the revenue. According to research, improving the customer retention rate by almost 5 percent can increase profits by 25 to 95 percent. Additionally, repeat purchases amount to more than 40 percent of the net

ECommerce business owners know that retaining loyal customers is more challenging than acquiring new ones.

Repeat customers are responsible for ushering in a significant amount of the revenue. According to research, improving the customer retention rate by almost 5 percent can increase profits by 25 to 95 percent.

Additionally, repeat purchases amount to more than 40 percent of the net revenue for an eCommerce site.

Repeat purchases are an excellent parameter for judging why your store is preferred over your competitors. It shows the rate of your current customer base who frequently come back to purchase again. This is not only a metric of loyalty but also defines the business‚Äô reputation in the retail industry.

For eCommerce businesses, it is imperative to encourage customers to keep visiting and purchasing from their platform, which will ensure the company‚Äôs sustainable growth over time. Thus, in today‚Äôs blog, we will discuss how businesses can boost their repeat purchase rate.

WHAT IS A REPEAT PURCHASE?

Repeat purchase refer to those made by customers who have shopped more than once. These are existing customers familiar with your brand and trust your store, so they keep returning to it.

The need for convenience primarily drives repeat purchases. A store‚Äôs repeat purchase rate (RPR) can range from 0 percent to 100 percent, and the higher the number, the better it is. If your business‚Äôs RPR is zero, none of your customers are coming back, and you must make improvements.

Customer behavior is different for repeat customers and first-time customers. In the case of eCommerce websites, repeat customers always know what they are looking for and go straight to purchase the desired product, leading to zero shopping cart abandonment.

Whereas first-time customers may take time to explore the site, find what they are looking for, explore prices, and even bounce or abandon their carts.

RPR is a metric that helps measuring brand loyalty.

WHY IS REPEAT PURCHASE RATE IMPORTANT?

The majority of eCommerce businesses tend to spend a large chunk of their marketing budget on trying to acquire new customers. However, only 41 percent of an eCommerce store‚Äôs net revenue is created by only 8 percent of its new customers.

When repeat customers frequent the same eCommerce store, it creates a halo effect. The ‚Äòhalo effect‚Äô is a term that describes the process of consumer favoritism towards a line of products sold by a store. This is influenced by the customer‚Äôs positive experience while navigating the store. The halo effect is often correlated with repeat purchase rate and brand loyalty.

The opposite of the halo effect is the ‚Äòhorn effect,‚Äô where consumers have an unfavorable experience on the store‚Äôs website. This may account for a higher bounce rate or frequent shopping cart abandonment.

There are several reasons why repeat purchases are better than first-time ones. Here are six reasons:

1. THEY GENERATE MORE REVENUE

According to a survey conducted by BIA/Kelsey, more than 50 percent of a business‚Äôs annual revenue is generated from repeat purchases. RJMetrics also reported that repeat customers spend 300 percent more than first-time buyers.

The more times a business can convince customers to buy from its portal, its potential lifetime value is greater. The more repeat customers convert, the higher their average order value becomes compared to new customers. This is because repeat purchases are made based on a brand‚Äôs trust and loyalty.

2. REPEAT CUSTOMERS ARE EASIER TO SELL TO

Gaining new customers is an important goal of eCommerce businesses. But when a brand has limited time and resources, it shouldn‚Äôt be wasted on acquiring new customers who may never buy anything. In fact, there is only a mere 13 percent chance of converting a prospect into a buying customer.

Things are entirely different when marketing to existing customers. By paying attention to customer service and striving to improve user experience, a brand can make existing customers want to purchase again. There is a 60 to 70 percent chance of repeat purchases, which happens because there‚Äôs already an established relationship.

For repeat customers, marketing efforts can be targeted toward customer retention.

3. NEW CUSTOMERS COST THE BRAND MORE

Businesses need to be financially savvy and save money wherever they can. Keeping existing customers involves far less hassle and resources than trying to gain new ones. Studies show that attracting a potential customer can cost 5 times more than retaining existing customers.

Since most brands operate on limited money, it is wiser to focus on ensuring customer retention.

4. REPEAT CUSTOMERS PROMOTE BUSINESSES

The best marketing tactic is through word-of-mouth of a loyal customer. Marketing is highly expensive, and getting influencers or ambassadors to endorse your brand can be costly.

However, by focusing on repeat business, brands can create a band of loyal customers who will willingly promote the business and market its products and services. The power of word-of-mouth referrals is unrivaled when it comes to eCommerce stores.

A study conducted by Bain & Company showed that repeat customers could refer 50 percent more prospective buyers than one-time customers. In most industries, the more a customer returns to the store to make a purchase, the more they will promote the brand.

5. THESE PURCHASES ARE INCREDIBLY PROFITABLE DURING THE HOLIDAY RUSH

During the peak season, like Christmas or wedding season, first-time customers spend only 17 percent more per transaction, but repeat customers can spend up to 25 percent more per transaction. Studies have also shown that the percentage of revenue from repeat purchases increases steadily even during a recession period.

6. MOST BUSINESSES ARE BUILT ON REPEAT PURCHASES AND CUSTOMER RETENTION

Businesses shouldn‚Äôt be a revolving door for customers. Research shows that 64 percent of businesses with decent customer loyalty make more money. The average customer is always on the hunt for the best deals and will more likely engage with a brand that offers loyalty points.

Implementing loyalty and rewards programs can greatly impact the business‚Äô growth. More than 80 percent of future profits come from 20 percent of repeat purchases.

HOW TO CALCULATE REPEAT PURCHASE RATE?

Calculating an eCommerce business‚Äô RPR involves a simple mathematical formula, which considers the purchases from repeat customers divided by total purchases on the site within a given date range.

The formula can be expressed in the following calculation:

Repeat Rate = number of customers who have shopped more than once / Number of customers

For example, if your brand has 100 customers, 46 have made repeat purchases, the RPR would be 46 percent.

Brands should track RPR daily, weekly, and monthly. This can be an important indicator of whether your efforts at boosting customer loyalty are paying off.

WHAT‚ÄôS A GOOD RPR FOR ECOMMERCE?

Benchmarks for a good repeat purchase rate for eCommerce vary from brand to brand. Most eCommerce businesses have an average RPR of between 20 to 40 percent.

According to former VP of Growth at Facebook, Alex Schultz, if businesses can get 20 to 30 percent of their customers coming back and making a purchase every month, it is a good sign that the brand is doing well.

If your brand has accumulated close to 50 percent of repeat customers, it should re-focus marketing efforts on expanding the customer base. And, if you have less than 25 percent of repeat customers, it‚Äôs time to incentivize purchases from your store and actively encourage one-time customers to buy again.

So, how can businesses increase their RPR? Let‚Äôs find out the answer!

10 WAYS TO INCREASE YOUR REPEAT PURCHASE RATE

To increase the RPR, you have to deploy customer retention strategies, and these strategies help the business to acquire post-purchase value.

We have listed 10 practical strategies that can be used to increase the RPR of an eCommerce business.

1. SENDING TARGETED POST-PURCHASE MESSAGES

One of the worst mistakes a brand can make is not following up after the customer makes the purchase. Sending targeted and personalized post-purchase messages can create a lasting impression in the customer‚Äôs mind, and this will keep your brand‚Äôs name on top when they need to re-purchase.

Targeted post-purchase messages can be sent in many creative ways. For instance, customers can receive relevant tips or a guide on using the product. Messages about similar or recommended products that the customer will enjoy can also be sent.

These messages can be sent via a marketing automation platform that delivers content across all channels, including email, push notifications, Whatsapp, etc.

2. BUILDING AN EMAIL LIST

Sending regular and targeted emails to existing customers is a standard marketing technique to encourage repeat purchases. Sometimes, customers need to be reminded of the brand and its offerings. And to do this, building an email list is crucial.

However, make sure that you use ‚Äúsend frequency optimization‚Äù and lower the frequency of your emails for customers who show declining interest.

3. INCENTIVIZING THE SECOND PURCHASE

Incentivizing the second purchase is a good way to improve your RPR. Discounts, promo codes, or referral links can be effective but only if used correctly. Especially for first-time buyers, this is an excellent way of luring them back in for a second purchase.

Brands can also use AI to identify customers who haven‚Äôt purchased in a while but are browsing. This way they can engage with offers to drive your numbers up.

4. SHOWING OFF REVIEWS AND TESTIMONIALS ON THE WEBSITE

The best way to convert a first-time buyer into a repeat customer is by leveraging other people‚Äôs opinions and reviews about the products on your website. Customers are more likely to trust brands when there is evidence that other shoppers like the brand.

A 2019 survey by BrightLocal proved that positive reviews could make 91 percent of customers more likely to purchase from a store. Similarly, 82 percent of customers can be discouraged by negative reviews. This framework is known as social proof.

Brands should highlight the positive reviews on their website by including them in landing pages, product pages, or even email campaigns. Posting pictures of happy customers is an excellent way of supporting these testimonials.

5. SENDING CART ABANDONMENT EMAILS

More than 70 percent of customers add items to their shopping cart only to leave without completing the purchase. Every 7 out of 10 people who visit your website abandon their shopping carts. This is a missed opportunity for every eCommerce business, and a significant portion of potential revenue goes down the drain.

An easy solution to this problem would be sending shopping cart abandonment emails. An automated email triggered when someone leaves their cart behind can act as a provocation, encouraging some customers to go ahead with their purchases.

6. IMPLEMENTING A REWARDS OR LOYALTY PROGRAM

Another effective way of improving your RPR is through rewards or loyalty programs. A strong rapport with the customer is the true driver of repeat purchases and brand loyalty.

Brands need to show their customers that they are valued, and this is a simple way of thanking the customer and increasing RPR. Points and rewards can be offered for every purchase the customer makes in the store, encouraging them to buy from you more.

For instance, H&M runs one of the most robust loyalty programs where customers are rewarded with points every time they shop, and these points can be later redeemed for discounts and vouchers.

7. UNDERSTANDING CUSTOMER SATISFACTION THROUGH SURVEYS

Customer feedback can help improve RPR and customer retention. If you want your customers to keep buying from you, you must determine what they think about your business.

If customers are unhappy with your business, it can result in a poor conversion rate. Through customer surveys, brands can listen to their customers, give them what they are looking for, and rebuild trust. When brands are able to solve issues by analyzing customer surveys quickly, customers are likely to stay loyal to the brand.

Brands need to ask the right questions during customer surveys. A few examples of customer feedback questions are:

On a scale of 1‚Äì10, how likely are you to buy our products again? How likely are you to recommend our business to a friend? Rate your browsing experience of our app/ website. How satisfied are you with our product/services? How did you learn about our website? 8. MAKE ORDERING FROM YOUR WEBSITE A SEAMLESS PROCESS

Customers like hassle-free websites that provide them with a seamless ordering experience, encouraging them to revisit the platform. For instance, Amazon has millions of loyal fans because ordering from its website is seamless.

One way of doing this is by letting customers create accounts on your website. They can save their billing and payment option, address, and checkout quickly whenever required, streamlining the buying process.

9. SENDING PERSONALIZED PRODUCT RECOMMENDATIONS

Personalization has a special place in marketing. Studies show that more than 33 percent of customers are likely to abandon a business if they don‚Äôt feel a personal connection to it. When brands interact with their customers, they have data on their preferences, which can be used wisely to tailor messages.

By analyzing the customer‚Äôs previous activity on the site, brands can send personalized product recommendations. This makes customers feel heard and increases their chances of purchasing again.

Also, brands should note a customer‚Äôs birthdays and anniversaries and send special discounts and referrals on these special occasions.

10. ANSWERING QUESTIONS AND COMMENTS ON THE WEBSITE

Last but not least, superior customer service is the key to increasing repeat purchases. Although 80 percent of businesses believe they offer exceptional customer service, only 8 percent of customers feel that they are receiving adequate customer service.

Being responsive to customers should be a given when running an eCommerce business. If you want to build a band of loyal customers, you have to engage with them and answer their queries across social media channels. Companies that actively interact with their customers have a higher ROI than those that don‚Äôt.

A happy customer is a loyal customer. Therefore, eCommerce businesses should prioritize strengthening customer relationships.

Several aspects of the post-purchase experience get neglected, leading to a low repeat purchase rate. Businesses should feel prepared to take on the challenge and focus on customer retention strategies.

Originally published at https://www.monetha.io.

11:24 • 17 days ago

11 Amazing Benefits of Customer Retention

Nowadays, a lot of companies are investing in customer retention efforts. They say it‚Äôs what literally any business needs. But what exactly are these benefits? Let‚Äôs find out! WHAT IS CUSTOMER RETENTION? Before discussing the list of benefits of customer retention, let‚Äôs make it clear what it is all about. So, what is customer retention? Customer retention refers to activities and actions

Nowadays, a lot of companies are investing in customer retention efforts. They say it‚Äôs what literally any business needs. But what exactly are these benefits? Let‚Äôs find out!

WHAT IS CUSTOMER RETENTION?

Before discussing the list of benefits of customer retention, let‚Äôs make it clear what it is all about. So, what is customer retention?

Customer retention refers to activities and actions that businesses take to decrease customer defection rates. Its main goal is to help businesses retain as many customers as possible through various initiatives. Examples of such initiatives are loyalty programs or reward systems.

11 CUSTOMER RETENTION BENEFITS

Here are 11 top benefits of customer retention:

1. IT MAKES YOUR BRAND STAND OUT FROM COMPETITION

From the perspective of customers, brands that make an effort to interact with them show how much they value their patronage. Unfortunately, there are only a few who genuinely do this which is why it‚Äôs a great opportunity to make your brand stand out.

Moreover, a lot of brands are more focused on acquiring new customers instead of retaining their old ones. This makes businesses that are retention-centric even more noticeable in the competition.

2. YOU CAN EARN MORE WITH LOYAL CUSTOMERS

Research reveals that engaged customers spend 60% more per transaction and buy 90% more than new customers. In contrast, disengaged customers can cost brands to lose some of their revenues. These customers refer to those that are actively spreading opposing options against the brand.

In addition, loyal customers also tend to be more accepting of price increases. However, you should just increase your prices needless with the confidence that they will stick around because they are loyal to your brand. Remember, the end goal is lifetime revenue so think of long-term outcomes.

3. CUSTOMER RETENTION IS MORE COST-EFFECTIVE THAN ACQUISITION

If you do the math, it is more expensive to invest in efforts to acquire new customers compared to the investment you need to make for customer retention. This is because you have to invest in the following to attract a new customer base:

Social media marketing Email campaigns SEO PPC Retargeting ads Web banners Prospecting leads Outbound sales

Each of these customer acquisition approaches has a hard cost. Besides that, they are labor-intensive and time-consuming. When you look at the result, you‚Äôll realize that customer retention efforts often can yield higher numbers across various metrics.

There have been several pieces of research proving this claim. However, although retention is much more cost-effective than acquisition, there‚Äôs no denying that it is not an easy feat to accomplish.

4. IT ALLOWS YOU TO UPSELL AND CROSS-SELL

Another major benefit of customer retention is that it allows you to upsell and cross-sell your products and services.

One of the most common mistakes many sales teams make is that they assume that once they sell something to a particular customer, then that is the end of it all. However, they don‚Äôt realize that by using customer retention, they are in the perfect position to know the needs and pains of their customers, allowing them to upsell and cross-sell their products and services.

5. IT‚ÄôS BETTER FOR THE EMPLOYEES‚Äô WELL-BEING

Customer retention is very similar to relationship building and a good relationship is much healthier for everyone involved since it‚Äôs mutually beneficial. On the other hand, sales are always transactional. They are price sensitive and affected by various factors.

Because of the nature of sales, a lot of employees struggle with meeting their regular quota because it‚Äôs not easy to convert strangers into paying customers. This is where focusing on being relational through customer retention can help. There‚Äôs less chance for engaged customers to switch brands when there are signs of trouble, protecting your revenue and making your employees‚Äô lives a lot easier.

Sure, customers are important for all businesses. However, employees are equally as important because they make the day-to-day operation run. This is why you should also pay attention to their well-being, instead of being solely customer-centric.

6. YOU CAN HAVE ROOM TO EXPERIMENT

Being able to establish a solid customer base allows you to expand the boundaries of your brand and explore new things. Whether this may be a new product line or messaging, a loyal customer base will still be there for you.

The important thing is, you should maintain the main reasons why they are loyal to you in the first place and they will stay with you no matter what new things you introduce.

7. CUSTOMERS WILL WELCOME YOUR MARKETING EFFORT

A lot of people easily get annoyed with marketing efforts, especially when there is a disconnect between them and the brand. This is exactly why email marketing campaigns fail mostly because a lot of customers unsubscribe, making it ineffective.

However, that is not the case for loyal customers. Loyal customers love to hear about new promotions and discounts that their brands have to offer. In some cases, even if they initially did not have the intention to buy, seeing the marketing effort can push them into making purchases almost immediately after.

8. LOYAL CUSTOMERS ARE MORE UNDERSTANDING

Poor customer service can be very detrimental to a business. In fact, a study shows that $1.6 trillion is lost yearly because customers switch to other brands after experiencing bad customer service. It‚Äôs safe to say that it‚Äôs one of the main reasons why customers switch to another brand.

However, loyal customers tend to have more tolerance for customer service shortcomings. Of course, this does not mean that it should be turned into a norm since the goal should be to consistently provide high-quality and consistent customer care.

9. MORE CUSTOMERS WILL EXPLORE YOUR BRAND

A brand that has proven itself with its flagship product or service has a higher chance of encouraging its customers to check their other products and services. These customers are also more likely to consider the newly launched products and services from this brand.

The simple act of exploring what are the other things your brand has to offer can be very valuable for sales revenues. At the same time, these customers can also provide vital feedback regarding the honest quality of the product and services and how they could be further improved later on.

10. LOYAL CUSTOMERS PROVIDE MORE FEEDBACK

Customer feedback plays a vital role in the success of a business. It can serve as a guide on essential business decisions regarding your products and services. It also provides you with a clear direction on which aspects you have to improve. Unfortunately, it‚Äôs rare to see customers who take time out of their busy lives and provide businesses with feedback unless they are loyal to them.

Whether it‚Äôs positive or negative, receiving feedback from customers is a good thing. Bad feedback is an opportunity to show them that you genuinely care about their satisfaction. Plus, the fact that you make an effort to improve based on negative feedback will make you stand out since most businesses out there just leave them unresolved.

11. WORD OF THE MOUTH REFERRALS ALLOWS YOU TO EARN MORE

You also get acquisition benefits from doing customer retention efforts. This is because your loyal customers will be the ones who will be bringing new business.

Loyal customers who are confident with your products and service won‚Äôt hesitate to recommend you to their brands and services. This is a very prominent trend, especially among millennials who are not shy about sharing their brand preferences online.

TIPS ON HOW TO INCREASE CUSTOMER RETENTION

There‚Äôs no denying that the benefits of customer retention can help a business soar to greater heights. With this in mind, here are some customer retention tips that you might want to consider applying to your business.

KNOW YOUR CUSTOMER RETENTION RATE

The first thing that you have to do to increase your customer retention rate is to know what your current rate is in the first place.

You can compute your customer retention rate for a specific period by subtracting the newly acquired customers and dividing it by the number of customers that you originally had at the start of the period. The result of this will then be multiplied by 100 to get your total retention rate.

Your retention rate will show you how happy customers are and how they value the products and services that you are providing. It will also reveal if your source of revenue is reliable or if you have to make some improvements.

INCREASE YOUR ENGAGEMENT

Increasing your retention rates means that you should also up your customer engagement efforts. Convincing customers to become repeat buyers requires target effort to help earn their trust. The best approach to doing this is by actively engaging with them.

There are several ways for you to increase your engagement with your customers. Some examples include the following:

Personalize content Make it easy for customers to reach out to you Take advantage of social media Make your brand meaningful and relatable BUILD TRUST

Trust is the foundation of a good relationship between a company and its customers. However, establishing this is easier said than done. But, there are basically 2 main things that you should always remember:

Building trust takes time Don‚Äôt assume that just because customers trust you then they will automatically buy from you.

There is no one-size-fits-all strategy when it comes to building trust. However, one of the main things that you should focus on if this is your goal is making sure that you are reliable and you consistently deliver value to customers. It would also help if you follow through with your brand promises and claims.

USE VARIOUS COMMUNICATION CHANNELS

In this day and age, there are various communication options available at a person‚Äôs disposal. If you want to increase your customer retention, you should take advantage of it.

When reaching out to customers, it‚Äôs also highly recommended to maintain a communication calendar. Don‚Äôt just send them a message or email on holidays and special occasions. You should also make an effort to re-establish your relationship by asking customers how they are doing from time to time.

However, make sure to be strategic when reaching out to customers. Your approach must still follow the essence of your brand tone and messaging.

Conversely, it should also be easy for customers to reach out to you if they have concerns or questions. You should make it more accessible for them to leave comments and reviews regarding the products and services that you have to offer. The best way of doing that is by opening various communication channels other than the traditional emails and phone numbers.

FINAL WORDS

When done right, customer retention can significantly help make your business successful. However, it does have a learning curve and you need to invest time, money, and effort into the process. But, given the list of benefits mentioned above, those efforts will eventually pay off.

Originally published at https://www.monetha.io.

Ontology

The Ontology and DoraHacks Hackathon: Let‚Äôs Vote!

Time to Have YOUR Say. Time: 5am, April 25th, 2022‚Äì5am May 2nd, 2022 (UTC) At the start of April, Ontology announced the launch of their $100,000 global virtual hackathon with DoraHacks, to help BUIDL the future of Web3. The Ontology grants program is running between the 1st-30th April, and offers Web3 developers the opportunity to showcase their ideas, particularly around privacy and
Time to Have YOUR Say.
Time: 5am, April 25th, 2022‚Äì5am May 2nd, 2022 (UTC)

At the start of April, Ontology announced the launch of their $100,000 global virtual hackathon with DoraHacks, to help BUIDL the future of Web3. The Ontology grants program is running between the 1st-30th April, and offers Web3 developers the opportunity to showcase their ideas, particularly around privacy and decentralized identity.

Projects are being submitted at the official DoraHacks portal, and developers are encouraged to keep submitting their projects, with more details available in the handy Dorahacks guide.

Of course, with all of these great ideas being submitted, we‚Äôre going to need some help voting for the winners. This is where you can help to vote for the projects you like, and increase the prize pool available to them. All of your votes will count towards the prize pool for developers, providing even greater incentives for them to build the Web3 we want to experience.

To thank you for taking the time to vote, we have over 1500 ONG to give away to people who take the time to vote for their favorite projects. Taking part couldn‚Äôt be easier, simply follow the official VOTING GUIDE.

Rules: 1. First-Come-First-Served (900 ONG)

The first 300 participants voting for candidate projects in the Ontology Grant Hackathon, will each earn 3 ONG.

2. Top Voters (390 ONG)

The 10 participants with the highest vote total will share the ONG reward pool

Top 1: 100 ONG
Top 2: 70 ONG
Top 3: 50 ONG
Top 4‚Äì6: 30 ONG each
Top 7‚Äì10: 20 ONG each

* If there are winners with the same number of votes, the corresponding rewards will be shared equally.

3. Lucky Draw (300 ONG)

Every vote you make equals one lucky draw ticket. 10 winners will each win 30 ONG in the draw.

Note that according to the voting rules, ‚ÄúThe Nth vote towards the same project will cost N*1 ONG, so if you‚Äôre going to give 3 votes to the same project, you need to pay 1+2+3=6 ONG‚Äù. If you give 3 votes to 3 different projects, you need to pay 1+1+1=3 ONG.

* Each participant can be rewarded only once. (The highest reward will be taken.)

ONG used for voting will not be returned to the voter, but will go to the project they voted for (minus a 5% protocol fee).

The Ontology team will reserve the final rights of interpretation of this event.

Learn more about our decentralized data and identity solutions on our website and official Twitter account. You can also chat with us on Telegram and keep up-to-date with the latest news via our Telegram Announcement account.

The Ontology and DoraHacks Hackathon: Let‚Äôs Vote! was originally published in OntologyNetwork on Medium, where people are continuing the conversation by highlighting and responding to this story.

Metadium

Ïù¥ Ï±ÑÎÑêÏùÑ ÌÜµÌï¥, Í∑∏Í∞Ñ ÏΩîÏù∏ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏ÏóêÏÑú Metadium ÌåÄÍ≥º Í∑∏ÎèôÏïà ÏàòÎßéÏùÄ ÌîÑÎ°úÏ†ùÌä∏Îì§ÏùÑ ÌòëÏóÖ/ÏßÑÌñâÌïòÎ©¥ÏÑú Ïôú ÌÉàÏ§ëÏïôÌôî ÎÑ§Ìä∏ÏõåÌÅ¨ ÏÑ∏ÏÉÅÏù∏ Î∏îÎ°ùÏ≤¥Ïù∏ Í∏∞Ïà†Í≥º DeFi, Web3 Î∂ÑÏïºÏóêÏÑú DID(Decentralized Identifier)Í∞Ä Ïôú Ï§ëÏöîÌïúÏßÄ, ÏµúÍ∑º Î∞úÌëúÌïú ÌååÌä∏ÎÑàÏã≠Ïù¥ Ïñ¥ÎñªÍ≤å ÏùòÎØ∏Î•º Í∞ÄÏßÄÍ≥† Ïó∞Í≤∞ÎêòÎäîÏßÄ, Ï¢Ä Îçî ÏûêÏÑ∏ÌïòÍ≤å ÏÑ§Î™ÖÌïòÍ≥†Ïûê ÌïúÎã§.

Web3ÏôÄ Ìï®Íªò DeFi, Í±∞ÎåÄÌïú ÏÜåÌîÑÌä∏Ïõ®Ïñ¥ ÏãúÏû•Ïù¥ Ïò®Îã§

ÏµúÍ∑º Îì§Ïñ¥ ÏÜåÏúÑ ‚ÄòÌòÅÏã†'ÏùÄ Ïä§ÌÉÄÌä∏ÏóÖÏù¥ÎÇò ÌÖåÌÅ¨Í∏∞ÏóÖÏúºÎ°úÎ∂ÄÌÑ∞ Ïù¥ÏïºÍ∏∞Í∞Ä ÏãúÏûëÌïòÍ∏∞ÎèÑ ÌïòÍ≥†, Ïù¥ÎØ∏ Ìï¥Ïô∏ÏóêÏÑúÎäî Î®ºÏ†Ä SaaS(Software as a Service)Í∞Ä ÎÑàÎ¨¥ÎÇòÎèÑ ÎãπÏó∞ÌïòÍ≤å ÎØ∏Îûò ÏÑ±Ïû•ÏùÑ Ïù¥ÎÅÑÎäî ÏÇ∞ÏóÖÏúºÎ°ú ÌèâÍ∞ÄÎêòÍ≥† ÏûàÎã§. Îã∑Ïª¥ÏãúÎåÄ Ïù¥ÌõÑÎ∂ÄÌÑ∞ ÏµúÍ∑º ÏïÑÎßàÏ°¥ Í∞ôÏùÄ ÌÅ¥ÎùºÏö∞Îìú Ïù∏ÌîÑÎùº ÏãúÎåÄÍπåÏßÄ Î™®Îëê ÏÜåÌîÑÌä∏Ïõ®Ïñ¥ Í∏∞Ïà†ÌöåÏÇ¨Îì§Ïù¥ NASDAQ Í∞ôÏùÄ Ï≤®Îã®ÏÇ∞ÏóÖ Í∞ÄÏπòÍ±∞Îûò ÏãúÏû•ÏùÑ Ï£ºÎèÑÌïòÍ≥† ÏûàÎäî Í≤ÉÏùÄ ÎãπÏó∞Ìïú ÏãúÎåÄÍ∞Ä ÎêòÏóàÎã§.

Ïù¥Ï†úÎäî Í∑∏Í∞Ñ ÌÉÑÌÉÑÌïòÎã§ ÏÉùÍ∞ÅÌñàÎçò Ï†úÏ°∞Í∏∞Î∞ò Ïã§Ï†ÅÎì§Ïóê ÏßÄÎåÄÌïú ÏòÅÌñ•ÏùÑ Ï§Ä Ïù¥ÏäàÎì§(Í≤ΩÏ†ú, Í∏àÎ¶¨, Ïú†Í∞Ä, Ï†ÑÏüÅ)Í≥º ÏΩîÎ°úÎÇòÍ∞Ä Í∞ÄÏ†∏Îã§Ï§Ä Î∞òÍ∞ïÏ†úÏ†Å ÎîîÏßÄÌÑ∏ Ï†ÑÌôò(DT, Digital Transformation)ÏúºÎ°ú Ïù∏Ìï¥, Í∞ÅÏ¢Ö Ï†úÏ°∞ÏóÖ ÌÉÄÍ≤©ÏóêÎèÑ Ïú†ÏùºÌïòÍ≤å ÏÑ±Ïû•Ìï† Ïàò ÏûàÎäî ÏÇ∞ÏóÖÏúºÎ°ú SW ÏÇ∞ÏóÖÏù¥ ÌèâÍ∞ÄÎ∞õÎäî ÏÑ∏ÏÉÅÏù¥ ÎêòÏóàÏßÄÎßå, Î∂àÍ≥º 20~30ÎÖÑÏ†ÑÎßå ÌïòÎçîÎùºÎèÑ Í∞ÄÏπòÏùò Í≤¨Ïù∏ÏùÄ ÎààÏóê Î≥¥Ïù¥Îäî ÌïòÎìúÏõ®Ïñ¥ Ï†úÌíàÏù¥ Ìï¥ÏôîÎçò Í≤ÉÏùÄ ÏÇ¨Ïã§Ïù¥Îã§.

Í∑∏Îü∞Îç∞ Î∂àÍ≥º 5~6ÎÖÑ Ï†Ñ Tether(USDT), Ethereum Îì±Ïû• Ïù¥ÌõÑ, MakerDAOÎÇò OlympusDAO, TerraÏùò LunaÎÇò BinanceÏùò BNB, USDC Îì± Îã§ÏñëÌïú DeFi Í¥ÄÎ†® Governance TokenÍ≥º ÌîÑÎ°úÏ†ùÌä∏Îì§Ïù¥ Îì±Ïû•ÌïòÎ©¥ÏÑú ÏûëÎÖÑ 8Ïõî $100B(100Ï°∞) Í∑úÎ™®Î°ú Ï∂îÏÇ∞ÎêòÎçò ÏãúÏû•ÏùÄ Ïò¨ 1Î∂ÑÍ∏∞ Î≤åÏç® $250B(250Ï°∞) Í∑úÎ™®Î°ú ÏÑ±Ïû•ÌñàÎã§. Ïù¥Ï≤òÎüº Ïö∞Î¶¨Í∞Ä ÏπúÏàôÌïú Ï¶ùÍ∂åÏãúÏû•Ïóê Ïú°Î∞ïÌïòÎäî Í∑úÎ™®Î°ú ÏÑ±Ïû•ÌñàÎã§Îäî ÏÇ¨Ïã§ÏùÄ Ïûò ÏïåÎ†§ÏßÄÏßÄ ÏïäÏùÄ Í≤É Í∞ôÎã§.

¬© Rhys Lindmark‚Ää‚Äî‚ÄäCryptoBoomer‚Äôs Guide To DeFi 2.0 ÏßÄÍ∞ëÍ≥º ÎÖ∏ÎìúÎ°ú Ïó∞Í≤∞Îêú Web3 ÏÑ∏ÏÉÅÏóêÏÑú DIDÎäî Í∏∏ÏùÑ ÏûÉÏßÄ ÏïäÎèÑÎ°ù ÎßåÎì§Ïñ¥Ï£ºÎäî Ïù¥Ï†ïÌëúÏù¥Îã§

2017ÎÖÑÎ∂ÄÌÑ∞ 2018ÎÖÑÍπåÏßÄ ÌïúÏ∞®Î°Ä ÎåÄÏ§ëÏ†Å Î≤ÑÎ∏î ÎÖºÎûÄ(?)Í≥º Token Sale Í¥ëÌíç(?)Ïù¥ ÏßÄÎÇòÍ∞ÄÍ≥†, Ï≤´ DeFiÎäî 2018ÎÖÑ MakerDAO, Compound, Uniswap Îì±Ïùò Ï¥àÍ∏∞ Í∞úÎÖêÍ≥º ÏÑúÎπÑÏä§Îì§Ïù¥ ÎÇòÌÉÄÎÇ¨Îã§. $DAIÏóê Ìï¥ÎãπÌïòÎäî MakerDAOÎäî Í∏∞Ï°¥ ÎßêÎèÑ ÎßéÍ≥† ÌÉàÎèÑ ÎßéÏïòÎçò(?) TetherÎ•º ÎåÄÏ≤¥ÌïòÎäî Stablecoin(USD $1 Îì± pegging, Í≥†Ï†ïÎêú Í∞ÄÏπòÎ•º Ïú†ÏßÄÌïòÎäî)Ïùò ÎπÑÏ†ÑÏùÑ Ï†úÏãúÌñàÍ≥†, ÏùÄÌñâÍ≥º Ïú†ÏÇ¨Ìïú ÏûêÏÇ∞Í¥ÄÎ¶¨Ïùò Í∞ÄÎä•ÏÑ±ÏùÑ CompoundÍ∞Ä, Í∑∏Î¶¨Í≥† ÌÉàÏ§ëÏïôÌôî Í±∞ÎûòÏÜå(DEX)Ïùò Í∞úÎÖêÏùÑ Uniswap Í∞ôÏùÄ Í≥≥ÏóêÏÑú Ï†úÏãúÌïòÍ∏∞ ÏãúÏûëÌñàÎã§.

Ïù¥Ïóê ÎçîÌï¥ 2020ÎÖÑÍ≥º ÏûëÎÖÑ DeFi 2.0 ÏãúÎåÄÎ•º Ïù¥ÏïºÍ∏∞ÌïòÎ©¥ÏÑú Protocol to control liquidity, ÏûêÏÇ∞Ïùò Ïú†ÎèôÏÑ±Ïóê ÎåÄÌïú Í∞úÎÖêÎì§Ïù¥ ÎÇòÌÉÄÎÇòÎ©¥ÏÑú Yield farming Í∞ôÏùÄ Ïù¥Ïûê ÎÜçÏÇ¨ÎÇò Í∏∞Ï°¥ Í∏àÏúµÍ≥º Ïú†ÏÇ¨Ìïú ÌååÏÉùÏÉÅÌíà, Ìï©ÏÑ±ÏûêÏÇ∞ Îì± Îã§ÏñëÌïú ÏãúÎèÑÎì§Ïù¥ Ïù¥Î£®Ïñ¥Ï°åÎã§. ÏµúÍ∑º Îì§Ïñ¥ÏÑú ÏïÑÏòà DeFi 3.0ÏùÑ Ïñ∏Í∏âÌïòÎ©¥ÏÑú Money Lego(Î†àÍ≥† Ï°∞Î¶ΩÌïòÎìØÏù¥ ÎßûÎã§)ÎùºÎäî Ïö©Ïñ¥Îì§ÎèÑ Îì±Ïû•ÌïòÎ©¥ÏÑú, ÎÇ¥Î∂Ä DeFi ÌåÄÏóêÏÑú Ïã§ÌóòÏ†ÅÏúºÎ°ú ÏßÑÌñâÌñàÎçò ÌîÑÎ°úÏ†ùÌä∏Îì§Ïù¥ Ïñ¥Îäê Ï†ïÎèÑ Íµ¨Ï≤¥ÌôîÎêòÎäî Îã®Í≥ÑÍ∞Ä ÎìúÎîîÏñ¥ Îêú Í≤É Í∞ôÎã§. Ïù¥Îäî ÏµúÍ∑º ÏΩîÏù∏ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Í∞Ä Ï†ÑÎ¨∏ ÌååÌä∏ÎÑàÏÇ¨ÏôÄ JV(Ìï©ÏûêÎ≤ïÏù∏)ÏúºÎ°ú Ï∂úÎ≤îÌïú UupfiÎÇò DeltaFinance Í∞ôÏùÄ DeFi ÏÇ¨ÏóÖÎì§Ïùò Ï∂úÎ∞úÏ†êÏóê Ìï¥ÎãπÌïúÎã§.

Î©îÌÉÄÎîîÏõÄÏùò Ï≤´ DApp Ï†úÌíàÏù¥ÏóàÎçò KeepinÍ≥º ÏΩîÏù∏ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Ïùò Î≥¥Îã§ ÌïúÍµ≠Ìòï(?) ÏÑúÎπÑÏä§Ïù∏ MYKEEPiN(ÎßàÏù¥ÌÇ§ÌïÄ)ÏùÄ Î™®Îëê DID(Decentralized ID, ÌÉàÏ§ëÏïôÌôî Ïã†ÏõêÏ¶ùÎ™Ö) Í∏∞Î∞ò ÏÑúÎπÑÏä§Îì§Ïù∏Îç∞, Ïù¥Îäî Îã§Î•∏ ÎßêÎ°ú ‚ÄòÏã†ÏõêÏù∏Ï¶ù ÏßÄÍ∞ë'Ïù¥ÎùºÍ≥†ÎèÑ Î∂àÎ¶∞Îã§. NFT ÏÜåÏú†ÎøêÎßå ÏïÑÎãàÎùº Ïù∏Ï¶ù Ï†ïÎ≥¥Îì§Ïù¥ Í∞ÅÏ¢Ö Í∏∞Ïà†Î°úÏÑú Íµ¨ÌòÑÎêòÏñ¥ ÏûàÎäîÎç∞, Ïù¥Îäî Ïù¥Îü¨Ìïú DeFi ÏÉùÌÉúÍ≥ÑÏóê ÏûàÏñ¥ÏÑú Í∑πÎèÑÎ°ú Îã®ÏàúÌôîÌïòÏó¨ Î≥¥ÌÜµ Í∞ïÏùòÏóêÏÑú ÏÑ§Î™ÖÌïòÎäî ‚ÄòÏßÄÍ∞ëÍ≥º ÎÖ∏ÎìúÏôÄÏùò Ïó∞Í≤∞'Ïù¥ÎùºÎäî Î∏îÎ°ùÏ≤¥Ïù∏ ÎÇ¥ÏóêÏÑú ÌÜ†ÌÅ∞ Ï†ïÎ≥¥ÎøêÎßå ÏïÑÎãàÎùº Í∞ÅÏ¢Ö Ìà¨ÌëúÏôÄ ÏäπÏù∏ Í≥ºÏ†ïÏóê ÏûàÏñ¥ÏÑú Ïù¥Ïö©ÏûêÎ•º Ïó∞Í≤∞ÌïòÎäî Ïù¥Ï†ïÌëú Ïó≠Ìï†ÏùÑ ÌïòÍ≤å ÎêúÎã§.

Í∞ÅÏ¢Ö ÌÉàÏ§ëÏïôÌôî Í±∞ÎûòÏÜå(DEX, Decentralized Exchanges)Îì§Ïù¥ Ïù¥Îü¨Ìïú DeFi 2.0 ÏãúÏû•ÏùÑ Í≤¨Ïù∏Ìï¥ÏôîÎã§. ¬© Keplerswap Web3ÎùºÍ≥† Î∂àÎ¶¨Îäî User-owned InternetÏóêÏÑúÎèÑ DIDÏôÄ ÏßÄÍ∞ë(Wallet)ÏùÄ Î™®Îì† Í≤ÉÏùò ÏãúÏûëÏ†êÏù¥ ÎêúÎã§

ÏµúÍ∑º Í∞ÄÏû• ÎßéÏù¥ ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÎêòÍ≥† ÏûàÎäî ÏßÄÍ∞ëÏù∏ MetaMaskÎ•º ÎπÑÎ°ØÌï¥, ÏΩîÏù∏ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏ÎèÑ ÌïúÍµ≠ Î≤ïÏ†úÏóê ÎßûÏ∂∞ ÎßàÏù¥ÌÇ§ÌïÄÏõîÎ†õ(MYKEEPiN Wallet)Ïùò Í∞ÄÏÉÅÏûêÏÇ∞ÏÇ¨ÏóÖÏûê Ïù∏Ï¶ù(VASP, Virtual Asset Service Provider) Îì±ÏùÑ ÌÜµÌï¥ Í¥ÄÎ†® ÏÇ¨ÏóÖÎì§ÏùÑ ÏßÑÌñâÌïòÍ≥† ÏûàÎäîÎç∞, Î©îÌÉÄÎîîÏõÄÏùò DIDÎèÑ Ïó≠Ïãú Ïù¥Îü∞ Í∑ºÍ∞ÑÏùÑ ÌÜµÌï¥ Í¥ÄÎ†® ÏÇ¨ÏóÖÎì§Ïù¥ Ï∂îÏßÑÎêúÎã§. Î≥¥Îã§ Î¶¨ÏõåÎìú ÏÉùÌÉúÍ≥ÑÎ•º Ìà¨Î™ÖÌïòÍ≥† Í≥µÏ†ïÌïòÍ≤å Í¥ÄÎ¶¨ÌïòÍ∏∞ ÏúÑÌï¥ Î©îÌÉÄÎîîÏõÄ Í∏∞Î∞òÏúºÎ°ú Ïã†Í∑ú ÌÜ†ÌÅ∞ Î∞úÌñâÏùÑ ÏßÑÌñâ ÏòàÏ†ïÏù∏ THEPOLÏù¥ÎÇò, ÏïûÏúºÎ°ú Í≥µÍ∞úÌï† Ïã†Í∑ú ÌîÑÎ°úÏ†ùÌä∏Îì§Ïù¥ Î™®Îëê Ïù¥Îü∞ ÏãúÏûëÏ†êÏúºÎ°úÏÑú DIDÍ∞Ä ÌôúÏö©ÎêòÎäî Íµ¨Ï°∞Ïù¥Îã§.

ÌäπÌûà ÎåÄÌëúÏ†ÅÏúºÎ°ú mirror.xyzÎÇò DEXÎ•º ÎπÑÎ°ØÌïú Í∞ÅÏ¢Ö ÌÉàÏ§ëÏïôÌôî Ïª§ÎÆ§ÎãàÌã∞, Web3 ÏÑúÎπÑÏä§Îì§ÏùÄ Í∏∞Ï°¥ SSO(Single sign-on, ÌÜµÌï©Î°úÍ∑∏Ïù∏) ÏÇ¨ÏóÖÏûêÏù∏ Google, Facebook, Naver Í∞ôÏùÄ ÎåÄÌòï Ï§ëÏïôÌôîÎêú ÏÇ¨ÏóÖÏûêÏùò Í≥ÑÏ†ïÏù¥ ÏïÑÎãå, ÎÇ¥Í∞Ä ÏÜåÏú†Ìïú ÌÉàÏ§ëÏïôÌôîÎêú ÏßÄÍ∞ëÏ£ºÏÜå, DID Í≥ÑÏ†ïÏúºÎ°ú Î°úÍ∑∏Ïù∏ÌïòÎäî Í≤ÉÏù¥ ÎãπÏó∞ÌïòÍ≤å Web3 ÌôòÍ≤ΩÏóêÏÑú Í≥µÌÜµÏ†ÅÏúºÎ°ú Íµ¨ÌòÑÎêòÍ≥† ÏûàÎã§. Í∞ÄÏû• Ïú†Î™ÖÌïú MetaMaskÎ•º Í∞úÎ∞úÌïú ConsensysÍ∞Ä ÏûëÎÖÑ 11Ïõî 21M MAU(ÏõîÍ∞Ñ Ïù¥Ïö©Ïûê 2,100ÎßåÎ™Ö) ÎèåÌåå, ÏßÄÎÇú ÎùºÏö¥Îìú ÎåÄÎπÑ ÏµúÍ∑º 2Î∞∞ Ïù¥ÏÉÅÏùò Í∏∞ÏóÖÍ∞ÄÏπò $7B(3Ïõî, 8.4Ï°∞ Í∑úÎ™®) ÌèâÍ∞Ä, Ìà¨ÏûêÏú†ÏπòÎ•º Î∞õÏùÄ Í≤ÉÏùÑ Î≥º Îïå, Ïù¥ Î∂ÑÏïºÎäî Îß§Ïö∞ Îπ†Î•∏ ÏÑ±Ïû• ÏÜçÎèÑÎ•º Î≥¥Ïó¨Ï£ºÍ≥† ÏûàÎã§.

Î≤§Ï≤òÏ∫êÌîºÌÉà(VC) Îì± Ìà¨ÏûêÏóÖÍ≥ÑÎèÑ ÎßàÏ∞¨Í∞ÄÏßÄÏó¨ÏÑú Îã§Îì§ Ïù∏ÌÑ∞ÎÑ∑ÏùÑ Ìé∏ÌïòÍ≤å Ïö∞Î¶¨Í∞Ä ÏßÄÍ∏àÏ≤òÎüº Ïì∏ Ïàò ÏûàÎèÑÎ°ù ÎßåÎì§Ïñ¥Ï§Ä Mosaic Î∏åÎùºÏö∞Ï†ÄÏôÄ ÏµúÏ¥àÏùò ÏÉÅÏö©ÌôîÎêú Î∏åÎùºÏö∞Ï†ÄÏù∏ NetscapeÎ•º ÎßåÎì† Marc AndreessenÍ≥º, ÏßÄÍ∏àÏùÄ Ïö∞Î¶¨Í∞Ä Ïì∞Îäî Î©îÏã†Ï†ÄÎÇò Ïä¨Îûô(Slack) Í∞ôÏùÄ ÌòëÏóÖ ÎèÑÍµ¨‚Ää‚Äî‚ÄäSaaS (Software as a Service)ÎùºÎäî Í∞úÎÖêÍ≥º DevOps Í∞úÎÖêÏùÑ Ï†úÏãúÌñàÎçò OpswareÏùò Ben HorowitzÍ∞Ä ÎßåÎì† A16Z (Andreessen Horowitz)Í∞Ä Í∞ÄÏû• Ïù¥ Î∂ÑÏïºÏóê Ï†ÅÍ∑πÏ†ÅÏù∏ Ìà¨ÏûêÎ•º Î≥¥Ïó¨Ï£ºÎäîÎç∞, Ïù¥Îì§ Ìà¨Ïûê Ìè¨Ìä∏Ìè¥Î¶¨Ïò§ ÏÉÅÏúÑ 3Í∞ú Ïπ¥ÌÖåÍ≥†Î¶¨Îäî Îã§Î¶Ñ ÏïÑÎãå DeFi, NFT / Digital Ownership, Security / Privacy Î∂ÑÏïºÏù¥Îã§.

https://medium.com/@nick.5montana/a16z-crypto-portfolio-breakdown-89836229def7 Metadium ÌåÄÍ≥º Ìï®Íªò Î®ºÏ†Ä ÏÑ†Î≥¥Ïù∏ NFT ÎßàÏºìÏóê Ïù¥Ïñ¥ DeFi Î°úÎìúÎßµÏù¥ ÎìúÎîîÏñ¥ Í≥ß Í≥µÍ∞úÎê† ÏòàÏ†ïÏù¥Îã§

Í≤©Î≥ÄÌïòÎäî ÏãúÏû• Î∂ÑÏúÑÍ∏∞ ÌÉìÏù∏ÏßÄ, ÏûëÎÖÑÎ∂ÄÌÑ∞ Î∂ÄÏ©ç Í¥ÄÎ†® Î¨∏ÏùòÎì§ÏùÑ ÏΩîÏù∏ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Îäî Î¨ºÎ°† Metadium TeamÎèÑ ÎèôÏùºÌïòÍ≤å ÏöîÏ≤≠Î∞õÍ≥† ÏûàÏñ¥ÏÑú, ÏßÄÍ∏àÍπåÏßÄ ÏßÑÌñâÌï¥Ïò® Í≤ΩÌóòÏ†Å ÏûêÏÇ∞ÏùÑ Î∞îÌÉïÏúºÎ°ú Ìñ•ÌõÑ ÏÉàÎ°úÏö¥ Î°úÎìúÎßµÏùÑ Ìï®Íªò Ï†ïÎπÑ Ï§ëÏóê ÏûàÎã§. ÏµúÍ∑º ReFi(Re-imagined Finance)Î•º ÌëúÎ∞©Ìïú Í≥≥Ïù¥ÎÇò DeFi 3.0Ïù¥Îùº Ïñ∏Í∏âÌïòÍ≥† ÏûàÎäî Îã§ÏñëÌïú ÏûêÏÇ∞Îì§ÏùÑ Îã§Î£®Îäî Í∏∞Ïà†Îì§ÏùÑ Ï¢ÖÌï©ÌïòÍ≥†, ÏΩîÏù∏ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏ Ïó≠Ïãú IRL(In Real Life) ÌòÑÏã§ ÏÑ∏Í≥ÑÏôÄ Ïó∞Í≤∞Îêú DID Í∏∞Ïà†Í≥º Í≤ΩÌóòÏúºÎ°úÏÑú Î≥¥Îã§ Ï†ÅÍ∑πÏ†ÅÏúºÎ°ú Î©îÌÉÄÎîîÏõÄ ÌåÄÍ≥º ÌòëÎ†•ÌïòÍ≥†Ïûê ÌïúÎã§.

ÏµúÍ∑º Î∞úÌëúÌïú Í¥ÄÍ¥ëÏù¥ÎÇò Î∞∞Îã¨, Î¨ºÎ•ò Îì±ÏóêÏÑú ÏπúÌôòÍ≤Ω Ï†ÑÍ∏∞Ï∞®Î•º ÌÜµÌï¥ Ï∂îÏßÑÌïòÎäî EMC(Energy/Mobility Cluster) Ïª®ÏÜåÏãúÏóÑ Ïó≠Ïãú Ï£ºÎ°ú ÏΩîÏù∏ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏ÏóêÏÑú Í∑∏ÎèôÏïà ÏåìÏïÑÏò® Ï†ÑÌÜµÏ†Å IT ÏÑúÎπÑÏä§ Í∏∞Ïà† ÏòÅÏó≠Ïùò ÎåÄÌëú ÏÇ¨Î°ÄÎì§‚Ää‚Äî‚ÄäÎ∂ÄÏÇ∞ Î∏îÎ°ùÏ≤¥Ïù∏ ÌäπÍµ¨ÏÇ¨ÏóÖÏóêÏÑú Î≥¥Ïó¨Ï§Ä DIDÏùò ÏßÄÎ∞©Ï†ïÎ∂Ä ÌôúÏö© ÏÇ¨Î°Ä, Í≤ΩÍ∏∞ÎèÑ Ìì®Ï≤òÏáºÏóêÏÑú Î≥¥Ïó¨Ï§Ä Ïã§Ï†ú Î∞©Î¨∏ ÌòÑÏû•ÏóêÏÑúÏùò Ïã†ÏõêÏù∏Ï¶ùÍ≥º Í¥ÄÎ†®Îêú ÏÇ¨Î°Ä, Í∑∏Î¶¨Í≥† Ï£ºÎ¨∏Î∞∞ÏÜ° O2O ÏÇ¨ÏóÖÏóêÏÑú Î≥¥Ïó¨Ï§Ä Ïö¥Ï†ÑÎ©¥Ìóà Ïù∏Ï¶ùÏù¥ÎÇò ÎåÄÌëúÏ†ÅÏù∏ Ïã§ÏÉùÌôú ÏÇ¨Î°ÄÏóêÏÑú Ïò§Îäî Í∞ÅÏ¢Ö Legacy ÎπÑÏ¶àÎãàÏä§ÏôÄ ÎßûÎãøÏùÑ Í≤ΩÏö∞ ÌååÍ∏âÎ†• ÎÜíÍ≤å Ïù¥ ÏãúÏû•Ïù¥ ÏÑ±Ïû•Ìï† Ïàò ÏûàÏùÑ Í≤ÉÏúºÎ°ú Í∏∞ÎåÄÌïúÎã§.

ÏïûÏúºÎ°ú Í≥µÏãú Ïô∏ÏóêÎèÑ ÏñëÏÇ¨ Í∞Ñ Î©îÌÉÄÎîîÏõÄ(Medium) Í≥µÏãù Ï±ÑÎÑê Îì±ÏùÑ ÌÜµÌï¥ Î≥¥Îã§ Îçî ÏûêÏÑ∏ÌïòÍ≤å Î°úÎìúÎßµÍ≥º Ïó∞Í¥ÄÎêú ÌîÑÎ°úÏ†ùÌä∏Îì§Ïùò ÏùòÎØ∏, Ï∂îÏßÑ ÏÉÅÌô© Îì±ÏùÑ ÏßÄÏÜçÏ†ÅÏúºÎ°ú Í≥µÏú†Ìï† Í≥ÑÌöçÏù¥Îã§. ÌïúÍµ≠ Í∏∞ÏóÖ Ï§ë ÌòëÎ†•ÌïòÏã§ Î∂ÑÎì§ÏùÄ Ïñ∏Ï†úÎì†ÏßÄ ÎßàÏù¥ÌÇ§ÌïÄÏñºÎùºÏù¥Ïñ∏Ïä§ ÌÜµÌï¥ÏÑú Í∞ÄÏûÖ/Ïó∞ÎùΩ Ï£ºÏãúÎ©¥ Í¥ÄÎ†®Îêú ÎÑ§Ìä∏ÏõåÌÇπÏùÑ ÎπÑÎ°ØÌï¥ Ïã†Í∑ú ÌîÑÎ°úÏ†ùÌä∏ Ï§ë Ï†ÅÌï©Ìïú ÏÇ¨Î°ÄÎì§ÏùÑ Ïó∞Í≤∞ÌïòÏó¨, ÏßÄÍ∏àÍπåÏßÄ Îã§ÏÜå ÏßÑÏûÖÏû•Î≤ΩÏù¥ ÎÜíÏïòÎçò DeFi ÌîÑÎ°úÏ†ùÌä∏Îì§Ïùò Ïã§Ï†ú ÏÉùÌôúÏóêÏÑúÏùò ÏÇ¨Î°ÄÎ•º ÎßåÎìúÎäî Í≥ºÏ†ïÏóê Ìï®ÍªòÌï† ÏòàÏ†ïÏù¥Îã§.

Stay tuned!

ÏΩîÏù∏ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏ & Î©îÌÉÄÎîîÏõÄ ÌåÄ

ÎßàÏù¥ÌÇ§ÌïÄ ÏñºÎùºÏù¥Ïñ∏Ïä§

ÏµúÍ∑º ÏóÖÎç∞Ïù¥Ìä∏Îêú ÏΩîÏù∏ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏ ÏõπÏÇ¨Ïù¥Ìä∏ÎèÑ Ìïú Î≤à Î∞©Î¨∏ÌïòÏãúÎ©¥ Í∑∏ÎèôÏïàÏóê ÏåìÏó¨ÏûàÎäî Í≤ΩÌóò ÏûêÏÇ∞Îì§ÏùÑ ÌôïÏù∏Ìï¥ Î≥¥Ïã§ Ïàò ÏûàÎã§. (Metadium TeamÎèÑ ÏÇ¨Ïù¥Ìä∏ Î¶¨Îâ¥Ïñº ÏûëÏóÖÏùÑ ÏßÑÌñâÌïòÍ≥† ÏûàÎã§)

Aergo

The Blocko Story Of The Century: The Great MOU

Blocko Signs An MOU With Bespin Global To Promote Blockchain MSP (Managed Service Provider)Business Blocko Has Just Signed The Largest MOU In Its History: Bespin Global Has 2000 Enterprise Customers! Introduction: The Great Cooperation: Blocko And Bespin Bespin Global and Blocko signed a business agreement to promote the blockchain MSP business. (Left) Han-Joo Lee, CEO of Bespin Global, and J

Blocko Signs An MOU With Bespin Global To Promote Blockchain MSP (Managed Service Provider)Business

Blocko Has Just Signed The Largest MOU In Its History: Bespin Global Has 2000 Enterprise Customers!

Introduction: The Great Cooperation: Blocko And Bespin

Bespin Global and Blocko signed a business agreement to promote the blockchain MSP business. (Left) Han-Joo Lee, CEO of Bespin Global, and Jae Shin, Executive Vice President of Blocko (Right)

It is evident that Blocko has made massive strides to become one of the largest service providers for enterprise blockchains, not only in Korea, but globally. Today, Blocko is proud to announce that Bespin Global and Blocko have signed an MOU to establish a cooperative system to promote the blockchain MSP (Managed Service Provider) business. These two enterprise grade behemoths compliment one another through mutually related industries. Bespin Global, whose aim is to be the world‚Äôs most automated management company meets blockchain specialization through the enterprise grade reliability and expertise of Blocko. This dynamic paradigm will emphasize and promote blockchain and cloud technology support through technological collaboration and specific know-how and solution models. This business agreement was made with the primary goal of providing blockchain technology conveniently and safely to corporate customers.

The Close Cooperation Model: The Compliments Of Enterprise Business Agreements

Bespin Global: Helping You Adopt Cloud Through Bespin And Blockchain Through Blocko

There is always a reason, a goal and a vision behind business collaborations; they‚Äôre never made haphazardly without a defined goal. These two companies plan to establish a close cooperation system for the successful initiation and implementation of the blockchain-specialized MSP project to cooperate with each other. Blocko will provide its technological know-how and related solutions as a blockchain specialized company, and Bespin Global will also support cloud technology know-how, networks and solutions. Blocko is a blockchain-specialized MSP (Managed Service Provider) that helps anyone easily use the often times complex blockchain systems that enterprises are still attempting how to utilize to their benefit, simultaneously it reduces the troubles of companies adopting blockchain through the Aergo mainnet-based blockchain technology.

Bespin Global is a cloud delivery platform company that provides comprehensive cloud services such as migration to the cloud environment, construction, operation, management, DevOps, big data, and security. Hanju Lee, CEO of Bespin Global, said, ‚ÄúThrough this MOU, Bespin Global‚Äôs experience of operating cloud-based services for over 2,000 customers and Blocko‚Äôs unrivaled blockchain technology are combined. I am confident that the partnership between the two companies will be a new leap forward in the blockchain management and operation industry. We will collaborate with Jonghwan Kim.‚Äù Jonghwan Kim, CEO of Blocko emphasized ‚Äúblockchain is a technological innovation with infinite potential for future development. Through this agreement, Bespin Global will be able to receive support for cloud operation management know-how. We hope that the mutual cooperation between the two companies will serve as an opportunity to easily provide blockchain-based services to more customers, such as the STO (Security Token Disclosure) service, which has recently been in rapid demand.‚Äù Now I know AERGO token holders are wondering ‚Äúhow does this benefit me as a token holder‚Äù, well, the possibilities are numerous.

The Bespin And Blocko Collaboration: AERGO Possibilities: Endless: 2000 Enterprise Customers

2000 Enterprise Customers From Bespin Global Will Be Introduced To AERGO: Its Time To Show You How

Bespin Global, specializing in cloud IT software, aims to utilize the AERGO mainnet through a variety of ways, adding to the utility of the platform on an immense scale. Bespin Global has expressed interest in converting their enterprise customers with a point system to an STO based platform that is, you heard it here first, on the AERGO mainnet! Jae Shin has begun to train the Bespin salesforce as well as the engineers to turn this vision into a concrete reality of utility for the AERGO mainnet. Not only will an STO based platform be utilized on the AERGO mainnet in association with Bespin Global, but increased utility will occur with GEMPAY, as it will play a massive role in this brand new paradigm; PlusFi will also be a major role in accordance to Bespin Global.

Through the utilization of GEMPAY, the net result of accelerated adoption of the AERGO token has the potential to be massive. GEMPAY will be the wallet that will hold all the various new tokens onboarded by enterprise clients as well as AERGO mainnet tokens; now why is this important, because it introduces enterprise customers to the AERGO platform and the AERGO mainnet tokens. The successful amalgamation of an STO platform as a service, built on the AERGO platform for new enterprise customers and the Bespin salesforce introducing this platform to their two-thousand enterprise clients cannot be overstated. PlusFi will also play a major role in these new inductions into the AERGO ecosystem. If you aren‚Äôt aware of the intricacies of PlusFi, think of it as the KlaySwap Service for the AERGO platform: PlusFi is the AERGO Swap Service. The AERGO Gem will be the stable token pegged to the Korean Won. As more tokens within the ecosystem are successfully issued and launched, there will be a necessary hub for swaps, this is where PlusFi comes in! Our expectation is that new token issuers will provide liquidity for their swaps, adding more liquidity into the AERGO sphere. The opportunities for AERGO‚Äôs expansion, with this brand new collaboration, are endless!

Conclusion: The Blocko Expansion: Fueling The Accelerated Adoption Of AERGO

As Blocko Expands, AERGO Adoption Expands

It is evident that the MOU between Blocko and Bespin Global will onboard numerous enterprise grade clients into the AERGO ecosystem through the expertise delivered by both of these companies. This is a massive feat for Blocko and Bespin Global alike; successfully amalgamating their mutual expertise‚Äôs to develop solutions for one another, while simultaneously enabling over two-thousand clients to interact with the AERGO mainnet, it is a complete win for every enterprise involved. This fostering of relationships are what propel businesses forward, and in this case, Blocko, Bespin Global and AERGO.

Disclaimer: Cryptocurrency investing involves substantial risk. Do not invest more than you can afford to lose! I am not responsible for your trades!

Safle Wallet

Safle announces its partnership with PolkaBridge

PolkaBridge is DeFi platform that aims to integrate financial applications such as lending, farming, swapping, initial DEX offerings (IDO), multi-chain and cross-chain AMM, initial NFT offerings (INO), decentralized P2P and other financial services within a single integrated platform. Partnering with an aim to enhance interoperability, ensure simplicity and spearhead the growth of multi-chain ass

PolkaBridge is DeFi platform that aims to integrate financial applications such as lending, farming, swapping, initial DEX offerings (IDO), multi-chain and cross-chain AMM, initial NFT offerings (INO), decentralized P2P and other financial services within a single integrated platform.

Partnering with an aim to enhance interoperability, ensure simplicity and spearhead the growth of multi-chain asset management.

The partnership between Safle and PolkaBridge will generate multiple synergies that will help grow the Web3 ecosystem and achieve true interoperability. Safle‚Äôs and PolkaBridge‚Äôs communities will mutually benefit from this partnership.

Safle through its proprietary wallet infrastructure helps create the foundational layer for cross-chain compatibility. The integration will allow PolkaBridge users to effortlessly access dApps, DeFi protocols, NFT marketplaces on multiple blockchains such as Ethereum, Polygon, Tezos, Velas, Polkadot & more. Polkabridge users will be able to access the Safle ecosystem through the Safle web application, mobile application and browser extension, all scheduled to be launched in Q2 of 2022! üëÄ

The PolkaBridge developer community will also gain access to Safle‚Äôs SDKs and APIs, enabling them to #buidl simply without any friction.

About Safle

A next-generation non-custodial wallet, self-sovereign identity protocol and Web 3.0 infra. provider for the decentralized ecosystem, governed by community. Safle is a decentralized blockchain identity wallet that enables secure private key management and seamless experience for dApps, DeFi and NFTs. In order to maintain a balance between developers and retail users, Safle intends to develop a wallet infrastructure in a completely non-custodial fashion using Open Governance Mechanisms via the SafleDAO coordinated and maintained by the Safle token economy. The native $SAFLE token will not only enable token holders to propose and vote on changes (governance privileges) to functionalities and feature sets of the wallet and node services, but will also create a self-sustaining token economic model where value will be generated by providing access to finance and identity in the decentralized digital world.

Website | GitHub | Discord | Twitter | Instagram | Telegram Ann | Telegram Chat

About PolkaBridge

PolkaBridge is a decentralized all-in-one financial applications platform. The PolkaBridge ecosystem is expected to include cross-chain AMM, Farming, Lending, Fundraising platform (Launchpad), NFT marketplaces & more. All products in the ecosystem are developed with Polkadot in the epicenter.

World Book Day 2022

A Time to Read

This year, for World Book Day, we decided to share some of our favorite books with you. We asked the Ontology team, our Harbingers, and our Partners to let us know the books they enjoy reading. Hopefully, this provides some inspiration for you to pick up a book, and dive in.

From Ontology Core Team Recommended by Li Jun, Founder of OntologyRecommended by Gloria Wu, Chief of Ecosystem PartnershipsRecommended by Gloria Wu, Chief of Ecosystem Partnerships (left two books), and Humpty Calderon, Head of Community (book on the right)Recommended by Erick Pinos, Americas Ecosystem Lead (left two books) and Morio Katayama, Japan Ecosystem Lead (book on the right)Recommended by Raindy Lu, Head of MarketingRecommended by Dr. Kendall Mao, Chief Scientist (Book on the left), and Christina Liu, Head of Social Media (right two books) From Ontology Harbingers Recommended by Ontology Harbinger Atherton HogeRecommended by Ontology Harbingers Atherton Hoge, DuMont, Alvin AbalosRecommended by Ontology Harbingers Dilip Ishara, Polaris, and Emilio Bur From Ontology Ecosystem Partners Recommended by Bjorn Niclas, CEO & Co-Founder of ROCKIRecommended by Juliun Brabon, Co-Founder of Unifi ProtocolRecommended by the Coin98 teamRecommended by Dr. Harry Behrens, the CTO and Co-Founder of bloXmove

Today the US Treasury‚Äôs Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) sanctioned three Ethereum addresses which are being used to launder funds stolen from Ronin in March by North Korea‚Äôs Lazarus group. This follows last week's action to sanction the address first used to receive these stolen funds.

Today the US Treasury‚Äôs Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) sanctioned three Ethereum addresses which are being used to launder funds stolen from Ronin in March by North Korea‚Äôs Lazarus group. This follows last week's action to sanction the address first used to receive these stolen funds.

20:13 • 19 days ago

KuppingerCole

PCI-DSS 4.0 launched

by John Tolbert The Payment Card Industry (PCI) Standards Council has published a major update to the Data Security Standard (DSS), version 4.0. This version is an improvement over the current version, 3.2.1, which came out in 2018.   The new publication directs organizations that need to be compliant with the standard to use Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) build-in ‚ÄúDynamic Analysi

by John Tolbert

The Payment Card Industry (PCI) Standards Council has published a major update to the Data Security Standard (DSS), version 4.0. This version is an improvement over the current version, 3.2.1, which came out in 2018.  

The new publication directs organizations that need to be compliant with the standard to

use Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) build-in ‚ÄúDynamic Analysis‚Äù, or risk-based authentication, in alignment with Zero Trust perform access reconciliations harden systems and servers deploy anti-malware solutions (Endpoint Protection Detection & Response) perform vulnerability assessments and use vulnerability management patch systems tighten network layer controls, including segmenting specific critical regions monitor networks and applications for suspicious activities monitor security systems for failures use file integrity monitoring deploy and integrate Physical Access Control Systems (PACS) utilize strong data and transport layer encryption use key management.

All of the items on the list above are good generic recommendations for any organization. Though PCI-DSS 4.0 was only recently published and will not fully take effect for up to three years, it‚Äôs never too early to suggest improvements. What follows is an examination of some of the provisions in PCI-DSS 4.0.

Section 1.4.4: ‚ÄúSystem components that store cardholder data are not directly accessible from untrusted networks.‚Äù The notion of trusted and untrusted networks is outdated and ineffective today. The principles of Zero Trust Architecture mandate proper authentication and authorization for each resource access attempt, regardless of source network or IP address. This is necessary, but not necessarily easy, to reduce risks of attacks that originate from what may have once been considered the trusted network. PCI-DSS 4.0 does refer to the NIST SP 800-207 but should have been more prescriptive about using Zero Trust as a basis for all aspects of implementation.


Figure 1: How Zero Trust Spans Multiple Areas of IT

Section 2.2.2 provides guidance for how to manage and use vendor default accounts. These accounts are defined as ‚Äú‚Ä¶accounts and passwords, including, but not limited to, those used by operating systems, software that provides security services, application and system accounts, point-of-sale (POS) terminals, payment applications, and Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) defaults‚Äù (p.64). PCI-DSS 4.0 states that such passwords be changed in accordance with requirement 8.3.6, or to have inactive accounts disabled.  Ideally, passwords should be eliminated with passwordless, risk-analysis-based, multi-factor authentication methods. For situations where service accounts with passwords still exist, PCI-DSS 4.0 should have mandated the use of Privileged Access Management solutions. The related technology of password vaults is mentioned in sections 8.2.3 and 8.6.2-3.

Section 4.2.1 mentions that exploits are available for old SSL and ‚Äúearly TLS‚Äù crypto. TLS 1.3 is the current version and should be at least recommended. Given the context around Point-of-Sale (POS) systems, we understand that full scale replacement of so many devices in the field will take some time.  

Section 5.2.1-3 requires the use of anti-malware solutions on all systems that are at risk from malware. This leaves an out for systems that cannot run anti-malware agents or are not thought to be at risk: ‚ÄúCertain systems, at a given point in time, may not currently be commonly targeted or affected by malware. However, industry trends for malware can change quickly, so it is important for organizations to be aware of new malware that might affect their systems‚Äù (p. 115). KuppingerCole encourages the use of full Endpoint Protection Detection & Response (EPDR) solutions wherever possible. If for some reason components of your architecture don‚Äôt support EPDR agents, then use other controls and monitoring tools such as Network Detection & Response (NDR).

Section 8 pertains to ‚ÄúProcesses and mechanisms for identifying users and authenticating access to system components‚Äù (p. 163).  This section applies to employees, contractors, consultants, and other 3rd-parties, but intentionally does not address accounts held by consumers or cardholders. It loosely differentiates between identification and authentication. US NIST SP 800-63 is mentioned, but no clear processes for identity proofing or provisioning are defined. Group accounts are discouraged but not disallowed. Identity de-provisioning is required for terminated users, and user accounts must be at least disabled after 90 days of inactivity. Sessions should timeout after 15 minutes.  

Section 8.3.3 says that a user identity must be verified before allowing modification to authentication factors. This is a good recommendation, but it is followed with an example of using Knowledge-Based Authentication (KBA) or using ‚Äúsecurity questions‚Äù. KBA is an extremely weak form of authentication and/or identification and should be avoided if possible.  

Section 11.4 states that internal and external penetration testing should be performed every 12 months. Annual pen testing is insufficient. Organizations in this industry should instead use more state-of-the-art Attack Surface Management tools.  

Section 11.5 calls for Intrusion Detection Systems to be used in critical areas. Network Detection & Response (NDR) tools are the more modern and effective alternatives.

PCI-DSS 4.0 does make some headway in prescribing security posture enhancements. Identity management components, though, are not as well defined as they should be. However, the reality is that the organizations that make up the payment services and broader financial services ecosystems are motivated to go beyond PCI-DSS to reduce the ever-present and seemingly ever-increasing risks of fraud. Moreover, members of the payment services and financial services industries have specifications from other industry consortia and differing regulations in various jurisdictions to consider when building and upgrading their infrastructure. Mappings and/or harmonizations between these specifications and regulations would be useful. Explicit references to governmental standards such as EU PSD2 (Strong Customer Authentication) and US NIST SP 800-63 (Authentication Assurance Levels) would be helpful as well.

Building compliant systems and then demonstrating compliance with specifications such as PCI-DSS requires effort and expense but are necessary to reduce fraud. For more information on how to choose solutions secure identity management systems (for both employees and consumers), Privileged Access Management systems, Fraud Reduction Intelligence Platforms, EPDR, and NDR tools, see our research.

12:25 • 20 days ago

Monetha

14 Best Earth Day Deals on Monetha

International Earth Day is here! We at Monetha have decided to share about our partners‚Äô brands and products that focus on sustainability, organic ingredients and keeping Earth greener. Earth-friendly home goods There is no better way in celebrating Earth Day than with great products and deals from our partners, starting with Earth-friendly home goods! 1. Click & Grow C

International Earth Day is here! We at Monetha have decided to share about our partners‚Äô brands and products that focus on sustainability, organic ingredients and keeping Earth greener.

Earth-friendly home goods

There is no better way in celebrating Earth Day than with great products and deals from our partners, starting with Earth-friendly home goods!

1. Click & Grow

Click & Grow offers smart technology for an indoor garden. Its patented, smart sensors and automated irrigation systems eliminate the need to worry about your indoor garden‚Äôs water supply or light intake. The unit‚Äôs base houses a water tank that‚Äôs large enough to keep water stored even after a month of non-use‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääperfect if you‚Äôre away on vacation and want to ensure your loved ones can still enjoy their garden.

Click & Grow significantly reduces the carbon footprint because the technology optimizes energy and water consumption. This is the future of gardening, and we should all embrace it.

With the Monetha app, you can get up to 80 Monetha reward points per Euro spent in Click & Grow.

2. AS Garden

AS Garden offers a wide range of products and plants, ideal for any balconies or home gardens. Nature lovers can start their own garden without spending too much money‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääthe plants and flowers are very affordable.

AS Garden has some of the most detailed plant cultivation and plant care guides on the internet, making it the perfect stop for your gardening needs. With expert tips on growing plants indoors, outdoors, or in an artificial environment, you‚Äôll be sure to find everything you need to know about the plants in your life. If you want to celebrate Earth Day properly, together with AS Garden and Monetha, you can get up to 80 Monetha reward points per Euro spent.

Rewards are available for our German and Austrian users.

3. Planeta Huerto

Planeta Huerto is a Spanish shop that empowers families and communities to take an active role in their health and well-being by providing viable and sustainable goods‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääfrom child toys, eco food to home and garden appliances. Because of this, their products are healthy for the body and beneficial for the planet we live on.

They design and sell eco-friendly products from sustainably sourced materials. Planeta Huerto rarely runs out of stock, and even if they do, they are quick to re-stock. They will offer special conditions for their products to celebrate Earth month-a 5 EUR discount on orders over 69 EUR and a 10 EUR discount for orders over 99 EUR.

You can also have free shipping for orders above 50 EUR or above 10 EUR if you are a member of their exclusive PH club.

But the Earth Day freebies don‚Äôt end here. With Monetha, you can get up to 24 Monetha reward points per Euro spent in Planeta Huerto.

Eco-minded technology 4. Eibabo

Eibabo is an online electronics store with more than 150,000 products and free shipping to more than 180 countries. With a 14-day refund policy and secure payment methods, shopping at Eibabo is safe and easy.

On top of that, there are over 3000 brands that are selling their smart home equipment on the website. The German platform is part of Eibmarkt and is inspired by technology that reduces carbon emissions and save big from your energy bills. As a platform working for a better future, it boasts over 500,000 satisfied customers.

Celebrate Mother Earth Day with Eibabo and Monetha to get up to 32 Monetha reward points per Euro spent in Eibabo.

4. K4G

K4G is a gamer‚Äôs paradise that gathers many digital products under one roof. A place where both new and loyal customers can easily browse through the vast collection of virtual items and gaming content. And they can do so while getting the best prices, exclusive discounts, and other beneficial promo offers.

K4G offers arguably the best deals on the gaming market, with many games priced at less than 1 EUR. But gamers can purchase even notable names in the gaming industry like FIFA 22 PC for 21.77 EUR, and Assassin‚Äôs Creed Valhalla PC can be yours for under 18 EUR!

While K4G is a great place to find deals, it can get even better, as Monetha offers up to 12 Monetha reward points per each Euro spent in K4G.

6. Eneba

Eneba is a digital games marketplace for desktop computers and consoles, where players can download and buy the latest entertainment. Eneba has more than 5 million active users from more than 200 countries worldwide.

Customers can make their first purchase with confidence in one of the over 18,000 games out there. You can make up to 40 Monetha reward points per each Euro spent in Eneba.

Sustainable fashion 7. Frye

Frye is the oldest boot manufacturer in America and one of the most popular brands for boots lovers. Its history and heritage are reflected in every boot, shoe and bag that the company produces.

There are regular sales of up to 50% off where you can find exclusive deals. On top of that, there is a Frye Exchange which is focused on sustainability, there you can buy or sell pre-owned shoes and boots for an even better price. With Monetha, you can earn up to 80 Monetha reward points per Euro spent in Frye.

8. Freshlabels

Freshlabels offers a wide range of products for their customers to choose from, including clothing, shoes, backpacks, and much more. Freshlabels offers sustainable products, and they label themselves as a reasonably priced company.

You can find some special seasonal sales‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääup to 60% off. So, even if you don‚Äôt get Earth Day sales, you‚Äôll still have access to great prices.

You can also earn up to 40 Monetha reward points per each Euro spent in Freshlabels.

9. Snag Tights

Snag was created to supply customers with a wide variety of tights and leggings. They‚Äôre dedicated to creating fun, trendy pairs of tights and leggings in various sizes, from extra-small to extra-large. The company aims to make its goods as eco-friendly as possible.

Snag‚Äôs mission is simple: they believe that their customers should be able to wear their tights comfortably, regardless of their gender, age, and shape.

Snag lets you get a 10% discount for more than five items purchased and 15% for 10+ items purchased. You can get up to 24 Monetha reward points per Euro spent in Snag.

Earth Day beauty, skincare, and wellness deals 10. ExSeed Health

ExSeed Health is on a mission to address male health and put an end to the 40% of all male-related infertility. It tackles demographic issues in many countries, especially in Europe, where the fertility rate is on the decline. They have lots of products in their offerings, including professional medical devices, a range of supplements, and tests.

You can even take a fertility quiz. The whole website is built on medical advice from experts, and it‚Äôs an option worth considering. The best of all is you can receive up to 40 Monetha reward points per each Euro spent in ExSeed Health.

11. Canatura

It‚Äôs not always easy to find products that align with your values; now, Canatura offers a curated collection of goods for those who choose to live a healthier lifestyle. They provide customers with a wide variety of vaporizers, cannabis products, health & wellness products, and pet supplies while promoting an exceptional customer experience that‚Äôs second-to-none.

The platform is quite generous, and they offer gifts for different orders. Starting from 20 EUR and up to 1400 EUR, that‚Äôs one hell of a deal. You can get up to 80 Monetha reward points per Euro spent in Canatura.

12. Nature‚Äôs Finest

Nature‚Äôs Finest is committed to providing its customers with top-quality health and beauty products at the best possible prices. Whether you‚Äôre looking for natural supplements, organic and gluten-free food, or luxurious skincare products, they have all of their bases covered. Customers can easily place orders on their website and expect speedy delivery times.

Not only that but they try to be 100% natural and use organic products whenever possible. Nature‚Äôs Finest celebrates Earth Day and are part of the most extensive environmental network within Europe‚Ää‚Äî‚ÄäFriends of the Earth.

On top of the 10% discount for the first purchase, you can also get up to 50% off on selected items. You can also receive up to 160 Monetha reward points per each Euro spent in Nature‚Äôs Finest.

Responsible travel 13. G Adventures

G Adventures is the best small-group adventure travel company in the world. No matter where you go, you can rely on the support of local guides and tours leaders to help you get the most out of your active holiday. It might be a cycling tour through Vietnam or a trek up to Kilimanjaro‚Ää‚Äî‚ÄäG Adventures takes care of everything so that all you have to do is enjoy yourself.

For Earth Day 2022, you will have a chance to get a hefty discount. There are many travel deals: Up to 20% off for all last-minute deals and 15% on selected deals. You can earn up to 48 Monetha reward points per Euro spent in G Adventures.

14. Tropicfeel

Tropicfeel creates travel gear that is incredibly good-looking and is easily packed into any suitcase. The collection ranges from travel bags to shoes and clothing‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääall of which are made of natural fibers and sustainable materials that are comfortable and durable.

They‚Äôve got a limited-time offer by Earth Day‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääyou can get the Dune sneakers with 35% off. But that‚Äôs not all. As Tropicfeel claims‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääthey use recycled materials‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääfor every single pair produced, they use six recycled plastic bottles. You can get up to 80 Monetha reward points per every Euro spent in Tropicfeel.

Originally published at https://www.monetha.io.

11:55 • 20 days ago

bankless
